page.title: 05Services
page.content: There is a small telephone exchange at Tarrant Hinton serving this area. Each village has its own public call box. The nearest Police Station is at Blndford and we have regular visits from the same officer who has travelled this 'beat' in his car for 15 years There is little crime apart from petty thieving and some poaching of deer and pheasant for which the area was infamous in past centuries. The only form of transport from the villages is a once-a-week bus service to Bandford. A more frequent service to the larger, more distant towns passes along the A354. Most households have at least one car and many people travel within or between villages by bicycle.
